activities_info.details: Facilitating the production and transport of masks made from surgical cloth with the help of both community members and student volunteers.
Providing residents, fellows, and physicians with childcare, pet care, and errands with the help of student volunteers.
Seeking donations and collecting certain types of personal protective equipment from community organizations and area businesses.

We serve many in our community who are struggling financially during these unprecedented times. Many are at an increased risk but do not have the means to get the essentials they need. We have partnered with the Society of St. Vincent de Paul food pantry who gives us grocery bags that we deliver to the low-income high-risk population. We have also coordinated food drives and toiletry drives to serve the growing need for our delivery service.
We have created informative videos on how best to get essentials delivered to individual's homes.

We offer companionship and support during these times of physical distancing to those who are lonely and/or isolated. We created a page compiling ideas and tips for successful physical distancing. Additionally, we formed a virtual companionship program to connect individuals.

directusSchool.name: University of Nebraska College of Medicine
